snippet: The rush of  violent events has masked the fact that officials in Washington still have only an impressionistic understanding of the militant groups that have established a safe haven in Mali.
abstract: Rush of violent events in Mali has masked fact that officials in Washington, Paris and African capitals still have scant understanding of Islamic militant groups that have established safe haven there; moreover, hostage situation in Algeria, apparent retaliation for French assault on Islamists extremists in Mali, only heightens concerns that Western military intervention could spur backlash that is worse than original threat.

byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Elisabeth Bumiller and Michael R. Gordon contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The rush of  violent events has masked the fact that officials in Washington still have only an impressionistic understanding of the militant groups that have established a safe haven in Mali.

headline.seo: U.S. Sees Hazy Threat From Mali Militants
headline.main: U.S. Sees Hazy Threat From Mali Militants
headline.print_headline: Mali Militants: U.S. Confronts A Hazy Threat
